meanings.definition: Overburdened with too much work or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: She felt overtasked with all the homework she had to do.
meanings.sent2: The tired student looked overtasked with all the books in her arms.
meanings.sent3: The little ant seemed overtasked carrying the huge crumb on its back.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches looked overtasked with the weight of the heavy snow.
meanings.sent5: The old cart appeared overtasked with the massive load of hay.

meanings.definition: To assign too much work or responsibility to someone.
meanings.sent1: The teacher didn't want to overtask her students with too much homework.
meanings.sent2: He decided not to overtask his team members with additional projects.
meanings.sent3: The chef would never overtask his apprentice with cooking a complicated dish.
meanings.sent4: The manager didn't want to overtask his employees with unrealistic deadlines.
meanings.sent5: The coach knew not to overtask his players with excessive training sessions.
